title: Best Madrid hotels with rooftop pools
excerpt: Finding hotels in Madrid with rooftop pools can be a daunting task, especially when you want the perfect blend of luxury and stunning views. This curated list not only highlights the best options but also ensures you can relax and unwind in style while soaking up the vibrant city skyline. Discovering these gems elevates your travel experience, turning an ordinary stay into a memorable escape.
intro: Dive into this guide to uncover the top hotels in Madrid that feature breathtaking rooftop pools, perfect for a refreshing retreat after a day of exploring.

hotels.name: Catalonia Goya
hotels.description: Discover the elegance of our luxurious 19th-century hotel located in Madrid's exclusive shopping district. Enjoy stylish, soundproofed rooms equipped with modern amenities like flat-screen smart TVs and private bathrooms, alongside convenient services such as a café-bar, fitness center, and 24-hour room service. With the Wizink Center nearby and easy access to airport shuttles, your stay promises both comfort and excitement.
hotels.highlight: Boasts a stylish plunge pool on the rooftop, providing a serene escape in Madrid's exclusive shopping district.

hotels.name: NH Collection Madrid Suecia
hotels.description: Experience the breathtaking views of Madrid from the stunning rooftop terrace at NH Collection Madrid Suecia, where modern comfort meets historical elegance. Delight in Mediterranean cuisine at Casa Suecia Restaurant and unwind with a cocktail at the lounge bar. Nestled in a prime location near cultural hotspots and vibrant neighborhoods, this hotel offers a unique blend of luxury and royal legacy, making it the perfect base for your city adventure.
hotels.highlight: Boasts a stunning rooftop terrace with breathtaking views of Madrid and a Mediterranean restaurant for an elevated dining experience.

hotels.name: Dear Hotel Madrid
hotels.description: Dear Hotel Madrid offers an unforgettable experience with its rooftop plunge pool and terrace, providing stunning city views for ultimate relaxation. Guests will enjoy stylish, modern rooms equipped with high-end amenities, including a 40-inch flat-screen TV and rain showers. Dine at the Nice to Meet You Restaurant & Lounge, where a contemporary menu pairs perfectly with breathtaking panoramic vistas of Madrid.
hotels.highlight: Features a rooftop plunge pool and garden with stunning panoramic views of Madrid.

hotels.name: Catalonia Gran Vía Madrid
hotels.description: Discover the Catalonia Gran Vía Madrid, where a stunning terrace with a pool offers breathtaking views of Gran Via, complemented by free Wi-Fi and a small gym. Housed in a charming historic building from 1917, the hotel features elegant stained-glass windows and modern amenities, including satellite smart TVs and private bathrooms. Enjoy exquisite Mediterranean and international cuisine at the on-site restaurant, and easily explore renowned cultural attractions like the Reina Sofía and Prado Art Galleries, all within walking distance.
hotels.highlight: Boasts a stunning rooftop terrace with a pool, offering breathtaking views of Gran Via and free Wi-Fi.

hotels.name: Hotel Victoria 4
hotels.description: Discover the vibrant charm of Madrid at Hotel Victoria 4, where comfort and convenience are perfectly intertwined in a prime location. Enjoy stunning views from the exclusive terrace, unwind with delightful dining options, and relax in one of the 48 air-conditioned rooms featuring modern amenities. With attentive concierge services and a stylish bar, your ideal getaway awaits at Hotel Victoria 4.
hotels.highlight: Boasts a stunning rooftop terrace with panoramic views and a stylish bar for relaxation.

hotels.name: Hotel Indigo Madrid - Princesa by IHG
hotels.description: Experience the stylish Hotel Indigo Madrid - Princesa, located in the lively Moncloa-Argüelles district, just steps from shopping and iconic attractions like Plaza de España and the Royal Palace. Recently renovated, the hotel features chic accommodations, a stunning rooftop terrace with city skyline views, and gourmet dining crafted from locally sourced ingredients. With exceptional service and modern amenities, it is the perfect destination for both business and leisure travelers.
hotels.highlight: Boasts a stunning rooftop terrace offering panoramic city skyline views and a gourmet restaurant using locally sourced ingredients.

faqs.question: What is the average price range for hotels in Madrid with rooftop infinity pools?
faqs.answer: On average, you can expect to pay between €150 and €350 per night for hotels in Madrid that feature rooftop infinity pools. Prices may vary significantly based on the season, with summer months typically being more expensive due to increased demand.

faqs.question: Are there any hotels with rooftop pools that offer great views of Madrid's landmarks?
faqs.answer: Yes, several hotels with rooftop pools provide stunning views of iconic landmarks such as the Royal Palace and Gran Via. For example, the Hotel Emperador and the NH Collection Madrid Gran Via both feature rooftop pools where guests can enjoy breathtaking city views, especially at sunset.

faqs.question: What amenities can I expect at hotels in Madrid with rooftop infinity pools?
faqs.answer: Hotels with rooftop infinity pools often offer a range of amenities, including sun loungers, bar service, and sometimes a restaurant or lounge area. For instance, the Hotel Indigo Madrid - Gran Via provides a rooftop bar where guests can enjoy cocktails while relaxing by the pool.

faqs.question: Do I need to make reservations for access to the rooftop pool at these hotels?
faqs.answer: Many hotels require reservations for rooftop pool access, especially during peak tourist seasons. It's advisable to check with the hotel directly when booking your stay to ensure you secure your spot, as some hotels may limit access to guests only or have specific hours for pool use.

faqs.question: What is the best time of year to book a hotel in Madrid with a rooftop pool?
faqs.answer: The best time to book a hotel with a rooftop pool in Madrid is during the late spring and early summer months, from May to June, when the weather is warm but crowds are still manageable. However, keep in mind that prices may be higher during this peak season, so booking in advance can help secure better rates.
